title: The BEST Amazon KDP Niche for Beginners (Not What You Think)

tactics.name: Avoid Broad Self-Help Niches
tactics.description: Focus on specific, underserved niches instead of broad self-help topics like 'overthinking' or 'self-discipline' which are highly competitive.
steps: Identify specific pain points within self-help (e.g., 'ADHD productivity for teens').
Use tools like Book Beam to analyze keyword profitability and competition.
Target niches with lower review counts and higher BSR potential.
caveats: High competition if niche specificity is insufficient
source_quotes: Most beginners choose super broad vague keywords like overthinking or self-discipline...
You need more reviews than just 20 or 50 if competing with 10,000-review books.

tactics.name: Add Unique Selling Proposition
tactics.description: Differentiate your book in competitive niches by adding a unique angle or design.
steps: Reposition the topic with a fresh perspective
Modify book cover and title for uniqueness
caveats: Without USP, competing with top books is unlikely to succeed
source_quotes: This book right here, clearly a worse version of this one. It's on the exact same topic... but it's a much worse version... with zero reviews and she is running ads to page one trying to compete with all the other books.

tactics.name: Niche Down by Demographic and Topic
tactics.description: Focus on a specific demographic and problem to reduce competition and marketing needs
caveats: May fail if niche demand is too low
source_quotes: You can niche down by demographic... and this book is doing 45 bucks a day

tactics.name: Niche Down Demographics
tactics.description: Target specific demographics and age ranges to create a unique market segment.
caveats: When the niche becomes too narrow to sustain sales
source_quotes: ook for moms specifically for babies between 6 to 15 months old.

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with lower competition
source_quotes: You can start making sales with 20 reviews, 50 reviews, right?

heuristics.name: Boost Low-Review Niche Entries
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting
source_quotes: You can't compete with that. And that's exactly why it typically leads to losing money because, you know, you can't get enough reviews...

heuristics.name: Low Review Count Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize boosting the niche
source_quotes: if you go into a super broad keyword... it's going to be very hard for you to go and market the book

claims.statement: Self-help niches are the most competitive on Amazon KDP due to saturation by established authors and marketing budgets.
source_quotes: Self-discipline or overthinking is literally the most competitive, the most saturated...

claims.statement: Self-help niches are competitive due to broad topics like 'how to stop overthinking' and 'how to be more confident'.
source_quotes: Self-help itself is not a problem. The real problem is that most people go into self-help with the most vague topics...

claims.statement: Niche topics require fewer reviews and have less competition
source_quotes: This book is doing 45 bucks a day... with just 45 reviews

claims.statement: A coach with KDP experience can identify keyword/title/cover issues before publishing
source_quotes: if you need help with that step... a coach who has experience in Amazon KDP

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identities with targeted problems and unique constraints to create underserved niches.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Lowers competition while maintaining profitability through niche specificity
source_quotes: There's actually a way to calculate how much you need in advertising budget to compete...
